description: The possessions of someone you arrested the other day found their way into your pocket.
You saw a dog that was drowning in the river, and you saved it.
The case you previously were a part of was successful as you uncovered the whole gang.
You stopped a pickpocketer.
You arrested a group of anti-communists marching to the center of Bucarest.
Your old friend from rural land gave you some jarred home-made goods.
Your station exceeded the quotas. Glory to our commerade Ceaușescu.
Your station got praised for good work.
You got as an autograph from comrade Ceaușescu himself.
Your brother got a job at the station as well.
You found a drug abuser on the street and arrested him.
You were given some money to keep a 'secret' about your boss.
You captured an unemployed, homeless person on the road. That cannot happen! Everyone has a job! Right?
Your neighbor Vasile whom you hate, and you created rumors about his anti-communist stances, was arrested.
You overheard a silly child say that Elena Ceaușescu is not her supreme mother. You arrest her parents.
You give a massive fine to a citizen who had a joke about a Ceaușescu. Such disrespect is unacceptable.
You see an at the back of the pharmacy. There are western pain killers which supposedly were 'expired.' (they lied)
You get an extra 'militia' meal as your colleague died.
For your contributions, you got 12 minutes of rest the next day. No less, no more.
Thanks to you, the parents who spoke out against a school teacher beating their kid have been arrested for anti-communist stances.
You charge and beat up a beggar on the street. THERE IS WORK FOR EVERYONE!
You captured a guy with a hollowed-out Romanian flag.
You arrested a priest who had anti-communist stances.
You stopped a nurse that complained about her workplace being 'dirty.
Somehow bullets of your gun hit protestors. Good job!
The leading critic of the Ceaușescu family was detained, and you are invited to question him. What an honor!
You run over with militia car protestors. They serve a better purpose when dead.
The cousin from the village gives you some fresh bread and Vișinată.
You told off your drunk colleague to your boss. Well done!
You confiscated weapons from a truck of some citizen. Take them for later.
The possessions of someone you arrested landed in your pocket.
You exceeded your quotas.
You imprisoned the most dissidents this year in Bucarest.
You arrest your neighbor who parodied Romania's national anthem and made fun of the glorious ruling family.
